I couldn't find exactly this hadith anywhere in the six books:  There does seem to be an authentic hadith that says something similar, but not exactly the same (Muslim 3/32)  Man's discharge (i. e. sperm) is thick and white and the discharge of woman is thin and yellow; so the resemblance comes from the one prevails or dominates. What's the scientific error here?  Genetically, there are dominant and recessive genes and these determine our genotype; and sometimes the gene come from the father or the mother.  Is it purely the male that determines the gender of the child? No. Even by changing her diet, the female can affect the gender of the child statistically speaking (see: Understanding Genetics).  So which part of the hadith is wrong?
